affiliation: University of Kentucky-Saha Cardiovascular Research center; Department of Pharmacology and Nutritional Sciences
manuscript_citation: Kim S, Yang L, Kim S, Lee RG, Graham MJ, Berliner JA, Lusis AJ, Cai L, Temel RE, Rateri DL, Lee S (2017) Targeting hepatic heparin-binding EGF-like growth factor (HB-EGF) induces anti-hyperlipidemia leading to reduction of angiotensin II-induced aneurysm development. PLoS ONE 12(8): e0182566. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0182566

components.data: Ascending aortic region - is the portion of the aorta commencing at the junction of the myocardium to the left subclavian artery. Dilation of the ascending portion is quantified by measuring the intimal area of ascending aortic region.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ascending aortic region - is the portion of the aorta commencing at the junction of the myocardium to the left subclavian artery. Dilation of the ascending portion is quantified by measuring the intimal area of ascending aortic region.

components.data: DEFINITION and PRINCIPLE
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Cut open the mouse ventrally, perfuse with saline, and dissect the aorta.
  2. Place dissected aortas in 4% paraformaldehyde or 10% neutrally buffered formalin for 24 - 48 hours. Once fixed, aortas are kept in saline at room temperature (or 2-8 °C)
  3. Before cleaning, allow aortas to soak in saline for a few hours. Clean aortas by removing adventitial tissues. Be careful to not tear or nick the aorta and important branches. Use saline to keep the tissue moist during cleaning
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Cut open the mouse ventrally, perfuse with saline, and dissect the aorta.
  2. Place dissected aortas in 4% paraformaldehyde or 10% neutrally buffered formalin for 24 - 48 hours. Once fixed, aortas are kept in saline at room temperature (or 2-8 °C)
  3. Before cleaning, allow aortas to soak in saline for a few hours. Clean aortas by removing adventitial tissues. Be careful to not tear or nick the aorta and important branches. Use saline to keep the tissue moist during cleaning

components.data: DISSECT, FIX and CLEAN
components.name: Section

components.data: • Leave 1 mm of innominate and left common carotid artery, and cut off the entire left subclavian artery. Cut open the outer curvature through the innominate artery, then to left common carotid artery, and then to the left subclavian artery. Cut open along the inner curvature of the ascending portion to the bottom of the abdominal portion
components.name: Description

source_data.description: • Leave 1 mm of innominate and left common carotid artery, and cut off the entire left subclavian artery. Cut open the outer curvature through the innominate artery, then to left common carotid artery, and then to the left subclavian artery. Cut open along the inner curvature of the ascending portion to the bottom of the abdominal portion

components.data: CUT
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Pin aorta flat on black wax with pins (Fine Science Tools item # 26002-20).
  2. Apply saline to keep aortas from drying.
  3. Label mouse number on both lid and box of the black wax. Imaging and analysis should be done within 3 days after pinning
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Pin aorta flat on black wax with pins (Fine Science Tools item # 26002-20).
  2. Apply saline to keep aortas from drying.
  3. Label mouse number on both lid and box of the black wax. Imaging and analysis should be done within 3 days after pinning

components.data: PIN
components.name: Section

components.data: • Take pictures of en face aorta with a Nikon digital camera. A mm ruler must be included in the images to calibrate measurements.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: • Take pictures of en face aorta with a Nikon digital camera. A mm ruler must be included in the images to calibrate measurements.

components.data: IMAGE
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Open Image Pro program 5.0 or 7.0 and open the image to be measured.
  2. Go to the “Measure” menu 6 “Calibrate” 6 “spacial calibration”
  3. Select “spacial calibration wizard” and follow directions, or click “new” and name your calibration.
  4. Click “image”, position line over the ruler, and change reference units to mm. Click “ok” and then “apply”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Open Image Pro program 5.0 or 7.0 and open the image to be measured.
  2. Go to the “Measure” menu 6 “Calibrate” 6 “spacial calibration”
  3. Select “spacial calibration wizard” and follow directions, or click “new” and name your calibration.
  4. Click “image”, position line over the ruler, and change reference units to mm. Click “ok” and then “apply”.

components.data: CALIBRATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Open Image Pro program 5.0 or 7.0, and open the image to be labeled.
  2. Label the image by clicking on the annotation button (O) click on “Aa”, then click on the picture and fill in text (study name, mouse #, date), and click “ok”.
  3. Burn the label to the image by pressing the double arrows (bb ).
  4. Save the picture.
  5. Label remaining images.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Open Image Pro program 5.0 or 7.0, and open the image to be labeled.
  2. Label the image by clicking on the annotation button (O) click on “Aa”, then click on the picture and fill in text (study name, mouse #, date), and click “ok”.
  3. Burn the label to the image by pressing the double arrows (bb ).
  4. Save the picture.
  5. Label remaining images.

components.data: LABELING
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Select the correct calibration for each image opened. “Measure” 6 “Calibration” 6 “set system” 6 “Apply”.
  2. Click “measure” menu and select “measurements”.
  3. Select the polygon button (-) on the Measurement Toolbar and trace the intimal area of the ascending region
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Select the correct calibration for each image opened. “Measure” 6 “Calibration” 6 “set system” 6 “Apply”.
  2. Click “measure” menu and select “measurements”.
  3. Select the polygon button (-) on the Measurement Toolbar and trace the intimal area of the ascending region

components.data: MEASURING
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Click on “input/output’. Chose measurements and click “export now”.
  2. Paste into spreadsheet
  3. Save image: Input/output tab, save as “mouse #....msr”. Image may be printed with overlay at this time.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of Quantification of Ascending Aortic Aneurysms
source_data.annotation: Do not close the image until the image has been printed and saved, and measurements are recorded in the spreadsheet

source_data.affiliation: University of Kentucky-Saha Cardiovascular Research center; Department of Pharmacology and Nutritional Sciences

components.data:
1. Quantification is verified by a second observer who is blind to study groups.
  2. After verification, aortas should be unpinned, put into properly labeled tubes with saline containing 0.02% sodium azide and stored at room temperature.
components.name: Description
